intro: Clidemia pilosissima var. glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of white or pink, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain ecosystems.
